intro: Brickellia secundiflora var. secundiflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf brickellbush, is a perennial flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The showy yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
